alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Bernard; Upper St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. Bernard Parish through 300 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout near Shell Beach and Yscloskey, or 18 miles southeast of Chalmette, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shell Beach. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Lower St. Bernard; Upper St. Bernard
